Subject: External Storage support (Netwrix Endpoint Protector)
Description: I've tried to connect to the SFTP Server hosted in the Ubuntu environment, and I set up the information according to the user manual instructions. On the SFTP Server, I configured following this link: https://vi.linux-console.net/?p=15322, and It worked correctly, and I tried to telnet for verification of the service, and there were no problems. On EPP, I configured the information like this: Additionally, My SFTP Server (IP: 10.128.0.6) and EPP are located on the LAN (network: 10.0.0.0/8). In the SFTP Server, I created a user named user1 and the password is "phuong2003" (I checked the connection by login in SFTP localhost and nothing anomalous happened; you can check the information again with the pictures below). Remote Directory: /Document/ Username: user1 (this is the username of the SFTP Server) Password: the associated password Error message: Incorrect credentials. I need your support as quickly as possible. My license is going to be expired. Thank you
DevOps_Steps_to_Reproduce__c:
1. Setup External Storage for SFTP.
2. Save the setting and wait 3 minutes.
3. Test connection. Wrong credentials error appears.
What_We_Know__c: User used to connect to the SFTP have the right top create files and folders in the SFTP.
